div.l: Lat se now if this place may suffice
Or make it rowm with speche as in your gise
Now Symond seide this Iohn bi Seynt Cutbert
Ay ys thow meri and that is faire answert
I haue herd seide men sal take of twa thynges
Swilke as he fyndes or take swilke as he brenges
But specially I pray the hooste deere
Get vs sum mete and drynke and make good cheere
And we wol payn trewly atte fulle
With empti hand men may na haukes tulle
Lo here oure siluer redy for to spende
This Millere in to toun his doughter sende
For ale and bred an roosted hem a goos
And bond hir hors it shold no more goo loos
And in his oune chambre hem made a bed
With shetes and with chalons faire yspred
Nat fram is owne bed teen foot or twelue
His doughter had a bed al bi her selue
Right in the same chambre by and by
It myght be no bet and cause why
Ther was no rowmer herberwe in the place
Thei sopen and thei speken hem to solace
And drynken eủere strong ale at the beste
A boute Midnyght wente thei to reste
Wel hath this Millere v̉erneshed his hed
Ful pale he was for dronken and noh noh noght red
He yoxeth and he speketh thurgh the nose
As he were on the quakke or on the pose
To bedde goth and with hym goth his wif
As any Iay he light was and Iolyf
So was hir ioli whistle wel y wet
The cradel at hir beddes feet was seet
To rokken and to yeue child to souke
And til that dronken was al in the crowke
